member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbolExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbolExtensions.CheckAnyTypeArgumentIsMarked``1(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Compilation)

summary.para: Check all type arguments recursively whether any types are marked specified attribute type.

This method will check all type arguments for this type symbol. For example, if the type symbol is like this: IReadOnlyDictionary<string, IReadOnlyList<IReadOnlyList<int>>> this method will check those parts:
IReadOnlyDictionary<string, IReadOnlyList<IReadOnlyList<int>>>
string
IReadOnlyList<IReadOnlyList<int>>
IReadOnlyList<int>
int

member.typeparam: The type of the attribute to check.
member.returns:
A result indicating:
The type symbol contains a argument that is marked .
All type arguments aren't marked .

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbolExtensions.ToFileName(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol)
member.summary: Get the file name of the type symbol.
member.returns:
The file name. Due to the limited file name and the algorithm, if:
The character is '<' or '>': Change them to '[' and ']'.
The character is ',': Change it to '_'.
The character is ' ': Remove it.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Reserved to be used by the compiler for tracking metadata. This class should not be used by developers in source code.
